results.label: sca
results.description: Node-redis from version 2.6.4 up to 3.1.0, when a client is in monitoring mode, the regex begin used to detected monitor messages could cause exponential backtracking on some strings. This issue could lead to a denial of service. The issue is patched in version 3.1.1.
results.descriptionHTML: Node-redis from version 2.6.4 up to 3.1.0, when a client is in monitoring mode, the regex begin used to detected monitor messages could cause exponential backtracking on some strings. This issue could lead to a denial of service. The issue is patched in version 3.1.1.

results.label: sca
results.description: Marked is a markdown parser and compiler. Prior to version 4.0.10, the regular expression `block.def` may cause catastrophic backtracking against some strings and lead to a regular expression denial of service (ReDoS). Anyone who runs untrusted markdown through a vulnerable version of marked and does not use a worker with a time limit may be affected. As a workaround, avoid running untrusted markdown through marked or run marked on a worker thread and set a reasonable time limit to prevent draining resources.
results.descriptionHTML: Marked is a markdown parser and compiler. Prior to version 4.0.10, the regular expression block.def may cause catastrophic backtracking against some strings and lead to a regular expression denial of service (ReDoS). Anyone who runs untrusted markdown through a vulnerable version of marked and does not use a worker with a time limit may be affected. As a workaround, avoid running untrusted markdown through marked or run marked on a worker thread and set a reasonable time limit to prevent draining resources.

results.label: sca
results.description: Marked is a markdown parser and compiler. Prior to version 4.0.10, the regular expression `inline.reflinkSearch` may cause catastrophic backtracking against some strings and lead to a denial of service (DoS). Anyone who runs untrusted markdown through a vulnerable version of marked and does not use a worker with a time limit may be affected. As a workaround, avoid running untrusted markdown through marked or run marked on a worker thread and set a reasonable time limit to prevent draining resources.
results.descriptionHTML: Marked is a markdown parser and compiler. Prior to version 4.0.10, the regular expression inline.reflinkSearch may cause catastrophic backtracking against some strings and lead to a denial of service (DoS). Anyone who runs untrusted markdown through a vulnerable version of marked and does not use a worker with a time limit may be affected. As a workaround, avoid running untrusted markdown through marked or run marked on a worker thread and set a reasonable time limit to prevent draining resources.

results.label: sca
results.description: The ejs (aka Embedded JavaScript templates) package versions prior to 3.1.10 for Node.js lacks certain pollution protection.
results.descriptionHTML: The ejs (aka Embedded JavaScript templates) package versions prior to 3.1.10 for Node.js lacks certain pollution protection.

results.label: sca
results.description: The path-to-regexp turns path strings into a regular expressions. In certain cases, path-to-regexp will output a regular expression that can be exploited to cause poor performance. Because JavaScript is single threaded and regex matching runs on the main thread, poor performance will block the event loop and lead to a DoS. The bad regular expression is generated any time you have two parameters within a single segment, separated by something that is not a period (.). All other users should upgrade. This issue affects path-to-regexp versions through 0.1.9, and 0.2.0 through 7.2.0.
results.descriptionHTML: The path-to-regexp turns path strings into a regular expressions. In certain cases, path-to-regexp will output a regular expression that can be exploited to cause poor performance. Because JavaScript is single threaded and regex matching runs on the main thread, poor performance will block the event loop and lead to a DoS. The bad regular expression is generated any time you have two parameters within a single segment, separated by something that is not a period (.). All other users should upgrade. This issue affects path-to-regexp versions through 0.1.9, and 0.2.0 through 7.2.0.

results.label: sca
results.description: The body-parser is Node.js body parsing middleware. The body-parser versions prior to 1.20.3 are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DOS) when "url" encoding is enabled. A malicious actor using a specially crafted payload could flood the server with a large number of requests, resulting in Denial of Service (DOS).
results.descriptionHTML: The body-parser is Node.js body parsing middleware. The body-parser versions prior to 1.20.3 are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DOS) when “url” encoding is enabled. A malicious actor using a specially crafted payload could flood the server with a large number of requests, resulting in Denial of Service (DOS).

results.label: sca
results.description: NPM `debug` prior to 4.3.0 has a Memory Leak when creating `debug` instances inside a function which can have a significant impact in the Availability. This happens since the function `debug` in the file `src/common.js` does not free up used memory.
results.descriptionHTML: NPM debug prior to 4.3.0 has a Memory Leak when creating debug instances inside a function which can have a significant impact in the Availability. This happens since the function debug in the file src/common.js does not free up used memory.

results.label: sca
results.description: In NPM `debug`, the `enable` function accepts a regular expression from user input without escaping it. Arbitrary regular expressions could be injected to cause a Denial of Service attack on the user's browser, otherwise known as a ReDoS (Regular Expression Denial of Service). This is a different issue than CVE-2017-16137.
results.descriptionHTML: In NPM debug, the enable function accepts a regular expression from user input without escaping it. Arbitrary regular expressions could be injected to cause a Denial of Service attack on the user‘s browser, otherwise known as a ReDoS (Regular Expression Denial of Service). This is a different issue than CVE-2017-16137.

results.label: sca
results.description: In NPM `inflight` there is a Memory Leak because some resources are not freed correctly after being used. It appears to affect all versions, as the issue was not addressed and no fix is found. NOTE: In the meantime, `logdna-agent`, a package that depends on `inflight`, has merged a commit to address this solely in their package (so it should be fixed in `logdna-agent` in versions 1.6.5 and later). `Node-glob`, a package that also depends on `inflight`, was also planning to address this by not using `inflight` after version 8 is released, but it is still being used.
results.descriptionHTML: In NPM inflight there is a Memory Leak because some resources are not freed correctly after being used. It appears to affect all versions, as the issue was not addressed and no fix is found. NOTE: In the meantime, logdna-agent, a package that depends on inflight, has merged a commit to address this solely in their package (so it should be fixed in logdna-agent in versions 1.6.5 and later). Node-glob, a package that also depends on inflight, was also planning to address this by not using inflight after version 8 is released, but it is still being used.

results.label: sca
results.description: The npm hbs package is an Express view engine wrapper for Handlebars. Depending on usage, users of hbs may be vulnerable to a file disclosure vulnerability. There is currently no patch for this vulnerability. hbs mixes pure template data with engine configuration options through the Express render API. By overwriting internal configuration options a file disclosure vulnerability may be triggered in downstream applications. For an example PoC see the referenced GHSL-2021-020.
results.descriptionHTML: The npm hbs package is an Express view engine wrapper for Handlebars. Depending on usage, users of hbs may be vulnerable to a file disclosure vulnerability. There is currently no patch for this vulnerability. hbs mixes pure template data with engine configuration options through the Express render API. By overwriting internal configuration options a file disclosure vulnerability may be triggered in downstream applications. For an example PoC see the referenced GHSL-2021-020.

results.label: sca
results.description: An arbitrary file upload vulnerability in formidable versions prior to 3.2.4, allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted "filename". NOTE: some third parties dispute this issue because the product has common use cases in which uploading arbitrary files is the desired behavior. Also, there are configuration options in all versions that can change the default behavior of how files are handled.
results.descriptionHTML: An arbitrary file upload vulnerability in formidable versions prior to 3.2.4, allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted “filename”. NOTE: some third parties dispute this issue because the product has common use cases in which uploading arbitrary files is the desired behavior. Also, there are configuration options in all versions that can change the default behavior of how files are handled.

results.label: sca
results.description: Send is a library for streaming files from the file system as an HTTP response. Send passes untrusted user input to "SendStream.redirect()" which executes untrusted code. This vulnerability affects send versions through 0.18.0, and 1.0.0-beta.1 through 1.0.0.
results.descriptionHTML: Send is a library for streaming files from the file system as an HTTP response. Send passes untrusted user input to “SendStream.redirect()” which executes untrusted code. This vulnerability affects send versions through 0.18.0, and 1.0.0-beta.1 through 1.0.0.

results.label: sca
results.description: serve-static serves static files. serve-static passes untrusted user input even after sanitizing it to "redirect()" and may execute untrusted code. This issue affects serve-static versions prior to 1.16.0 and 2.0.x prior to 2.1.0.
results.descriptionHTML: serve-static serves static files. serve-static passes untrusted user input even after sanitizing it to “redirect()” and may execute untrusted code. This issue affects serve-static versions prior to 1.16.0 and 2.0.x prior to 2.1.0.

results.label: sca
results.description: The package `body-parser` is vulnerable to prototype pollution, as it does no sanitation to the values received via the incoming JSON data. A remote attacker can inject a `__proto__` object to the application, which would successfully be parsed on the server side. This affects the integrity of the application.
results.descriptionHTML: The package body-parser is vulnerable to prototype pollution, as it does no sanitation to the values received via the incoming JSON data. A remote attacker can inject a __proto__ object to the application, which would successfully be parsed on the server side. This affects the integrity of the application.

results.label: sca
results.description: Marked prior to 1.1.1 has a regex that accepts "any character" unrestrictedly in `rules.js` and this could lead to a Regular Expression Denial of Service (REDoS) attack.
results.descriptionHTML: Marked prior to 1.1.1 has a regex that accepts “any character” unrestrictedly in rules.js and this could lead to a Regular Expression Denial of Service (REDoS) attack.
